p: Cinnamic acids and derivatives, as well as short chain carboxylic acids, are common in diets rich in vegetables and fruits [ 105]. Its health benefits as antioxidants and diabetes-preventing molecules have been widely studied, as discussed above. Furthermore, some of the species with a vast array of cinnamic acids and derivatives reported, namely E. crus-galli, I. cylindrica, and Z. aquatica, are already considered edible [ 51, 53, 55]. Such status, allied with the advantages of a diet rich in this class of compounds highlights the benefits of their introduction in the human diet.
